paragraphs.text:
%md
## Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!
### We've all been there.   We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute.   A bottle of wine is always a good option.   But which one?   There are so many!   And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift.   Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likley to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $35).  
##### Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc.   Wine Reviews and Twitter Handle were removed.   Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 <https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews>  

### Steps
#### 1. Explore the data
#### 2. Define the Target Attribute (GT_90_Points vs. LT_90_Points)
#### 3. Find the Key Attributes that Most Influence GT_90_Points_Bin)
#### 4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy
#### 5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

msg.data:
Selecting a wine to bring to a party that is likley to be good and is also inexpensive!

We've all been there. We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute. A bottle of wine is always a good option. But which one? There are so many! And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift. Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likley to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $35).

Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Wine Reviews and Twitter Handle were removed. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews

Steps

1. Explore the data

2. Define the Target Attribute (GT_90_Points vs. LT_90_Points)

3. Find the Key Attributes that Most Influence GT_90_Points_Bin)

4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy

5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

paragraphs.title: Create table

msg.data:
Table WINEREVIEWS130K_BIN dropped.


---------------------------

Table WINEREVIEWS130K_BIN created.


---------------------------

paragraphs.title: Add POINTS_BIN column
paragraphs.text:
%sql
ALTER TABLE WineReviews130K_bin ADD POINTS_BIN VARCHAR2(15);

paragraphs.title: Populate POINTS_BIN column as Greater than 90 points and Less than 90 points
paragraphs.text:
%script

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'GT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS.ID
        FROM DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS
        WHERE DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS.POINTS >= 90 and DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

UPDATE WineReviews130K_bin
SET POINTS_BIN = 'LT_90_Points'
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS.ID
        FROM DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS
        WHERE DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS.POINTS < 90 and DHVANI.WineReviews130k_DS.ID = WineReviews130K_bin.ID);

%sql
select * from WineReviews130K_bin;

The 2011 is a tart, medium-bodied wine blanketed in caramel- and mocha-scented oak. Enough modest cherry fruit pokes through, and there's an attractive, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2018.
99042	Italy	Moganazzi Volta Sciara Rosso	87	45	Sicily & Sardinia	Etna		Kerin O’Keefe	@kerinokeefe	Le Vigne di Eli 2012 Moganazzi Volta Sciara Rosso  (Etna)	Red Blend	Le Vigne di Eli	LT_90_Points	Subdued aromas of red berry, dried meat and a touch of oak lead the nose. The palate discloses raw red cherry, thyme, anise and clove alongside biting, astringent tannins that dry out the mouth. Drink after 2017.
60292	France		90		Bordeaux	Côtes de Castillon		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Château Robin 2004  Côtes de Castillon	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Château Robin	GT_90_Points	Dominated by Merlot and Cabernet Franc, typical of this region to the east of Saint-Emilion, this is a ripe, smooth wine, its tannins spread through the fresh red fruit flavors. There's lively acidity here as well, a wine whose tannins promise aging.
10003	Canada	Icewine	91	60	Ontario	Niagara Peninsula		Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Inniskillin 2011 Icewine Vidal (Niagara Peninsula)	Vidal	Inniskillin	GT_90_Points	This vibrantly aromatic wine brings generous notes of honey, pineapple, papaya and apricot. It's intensely sweet and rich in flavor and feel, lingering on the finish.
73425	France	L'Enclos des Graves	86	20	Southwest France	Cahors		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Château Fantou 2012 L'Enclos des Graves Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)	Malbec-Merlot	Château Fantou	LT_90_Points	This spicy wine with its aromatic character is fruity while also having some structure. The 90% Malbec/10% Merlot blend has a dry core, juicy red currant fruits and considerable acidity. With only a minimum of wood aging, it is ready to drink.
110940	US		83	10	California	California	California Other			Cable Car 2007 Merlot (California)	Merlot	Cable Car	LT_90_Points	A soft, simple, fruity Merlot. Tastes like a cherry, blackberry, roasted almond, cocoa and cinnamon granola bar, melted into wine.
107830	France	Sauvage Brut Rosé	88	60	Champagne	Champagne		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Piper-Heidsieck NV Sauvage Brut Rosé  (Champagne)	Champagne Blend	Piper-Heidsieck	LT_90_Points	Dark orange in color, this dry wine relies on its fresh red fruits to give balance. It's perfumed with a light touch of tannin from the red wine used to produce the color. This is a food-friendly wine, crisp and dry at the end.
71917	US		92	75	California	Mount Veeder	Napa			Robert Craig 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Robert Craig	GT_90_Points	Tannins are the star here, the tough, young, chewy mountain kind that straitjacket the wine in its youth. This beautiful Bordeaux-style Cab will be best between 2009–2013.
21608	US		91	22	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Kale 2013 Rosé (Napa Valley)	Rosé	Kale	GT_90_Points	Made from a blend of 62% Grenache and 38% Syrah, this is a classically dry, refreshingly crisp rosé, pink-salmon in color that's intense yet soft, crafted in a Provence style. The grapes come from Rutherford, Atlas Peak and Sonoma County's Kick Ranch, tasting of fresh raspberry and spring flowers, a bite of wet stone on the finish.
94494	Austria	Stein	90	20	Kamptal			Anne Krebiehl MW	@AnneInVino	Jurtschitsch 2013 Stein Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)	Grüner Veltliner	Jurtschitsch	GT_90_Points	A subtle mix of pear and pepper plays on the nose. 89963	US	Inspiration Vineyard Magnolia Series	87	20	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma			Krutz 2012 Inspiration Vineyard Magnolia Series Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)	Chardonnay	Krutz	LT_90_Points	Krutz has blended this Chardonnay to drink now. 11689	Spain	Mas Elena Merlot-Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon	86	22	Catalonia	Penedès		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Parés Baltà 2011 Mas Elena Merlot-Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Penedès)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Parés Baltà	LT_90_Points	Rubbery and gaseous smelling, this Bordeaux blend also sports plum and berry scents. 39556	US		87	26	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Frog's Leap 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)	Chardonnay	Frog's Leap	LT_90_Points	A good, everyday Chard. 122209	US	Special Edition	86	75	California	Chalk Hill	Sonoma			Herzog 2004 Special Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Herzog	LT_90_Points	This bottling has been variable over the years, and the '04 is not showing it at its best. 37276	US		88	18	California	Anderson Valley		Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Joleté 2012 Riesling (Anderson Valley)	Riesling	Joleté	LT_90_Points	This wine keeps true to the varietal character of German Riesling, with an aroma of petrol—that British term that describes Riesiing's oddly attractive and mild diesel smell—plus peach and green apple. 102311	US	Les Collines Vineyard	88	34	Washington	Walla Walla Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Burnt Bridge 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Burnt Bridge	LT_90_Points	This wine offers notes of Hershey's chocolate along with high-toned herbs and dried cherries. 123644	Italy	Occhio a Vento	87	14	Tuscany	Maremma				Rocca delle Macìe 2011 Occhio a Vento Vermentino (Maremma)	Vermentino	Rocca delle Macìe	LT_90_Points	Occhio a Vento, which means “eye to the wind,” is an affordable, easy-drinking Vermentino that shows very crisp aromas of cut grass, kiwi, citrus, green apple and peach. There's a nice touch of mineral dryness on the finish.
114151	Portugal	3 Castas Nature Rosé	85	11	Tejo			Roger Voss	@vossroger	Fiuza NV 3 Castas Nature Rosé Sparkling (Tejo)	Portuguese Sparkling	Fiuza	LT_90_Points	A soft, off-dry rosé, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon. 86450	US	Glass House Vineyard	91	62	California	Sonoma Coast	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Ram's Gate 2012 Glass House Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)	Pinot Noir	Ram's Gate	GT_90_Points	This generous wine is big and full on the nose, with two-thirds new French oak making itself felt in texture and aroma but entirely well-managed, resulting in a balanced wine. 117533	Australia	The Lodge Hill Dry	90	18	South Australia	Clare Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Jim Barry 2011 The Lodge Hill Dry Riesling (Clare Valley)	Riesling	Jim Barry	GT_90_Points	Wet stone and lemon-lime. 122587	France	Brut Rosé	89	57	Champagne	Champagne		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Deutz NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)	Champagne Blend	Deutz	LT_90_Points	This fine, perfumed wine is soft and stylish—a hallmark of the nonvintage Champagnes from this producer. 37002	Italy		92	56	Tuscany	Brunello di Montalcino		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Collosorbo 1999  Brunello di Montalcino	Sangiovese	Collosorbo	GT_90_Points	Truly classy, with a deep nose of earth, tar and pure berry fruit. 7360	US	Bunch Select Late Harvest	88	34	New York	Finger Lakes	Finger Lakes	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Heron Hill 2010 Bunch Select Late Harvest Riesling (Finger Lakes)	Riesling	Heron Hill	LT_90_Points	Honey and almond notes lend a nutty earthiness to lifted citrus aromas. 21295	US		87	13	California	Monterey	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	La Merika 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)	Chardonnay	La Merika	LT_90_Points	Warm and clean seared-apple notes greet the nose on this bottling, with white peach, apple blossom and concrete aromas. 96255	US		89	20	California	Central Coast	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Claiborne & Churchill 2015 Riesling (Central Coast)	Riesling	Claiborne & Churchill	LT_90_Points	Lemon zest and grapefruit aromas seemingly float atop the mineral-laden nose of this wine. 67678	Spain	Alone	85	11	Levante	Alicante		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bocopa 2015 Alone Rosé (Alicante)	Rosé	Bocopa	LT_90_Points	Aromas of field brush and citrus are a touch funky. 81785	France		87	14	Provence	Côtes de Provence		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Domaine Houchart 2014 White (Côtes de Provence)	Provence white blend	Domaine Houchart	LT_90_Points	Spicy, aromatic and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. It's full of lemon, mango and orange peel, round and rich.
66849	France	Cuvée René Dopff	89	21	Alsace	Alsace		Anne Krebiehl MW	@AnneInVino	Dopff & Irion 2014 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Gris (Alsace)	Pinot Gris	Dopff & Irion	LT_90_Points	Charmingly ripe and aromatic notes of juicy, yellow pear on nose and palate make for an ultrafriendly, easy-drinking and utterly fruit-driven wine. 8092	Portugal	Vinha da Costa	91	58	Bairrada			Roger Voss	@vossroger	Campolargo 2008 Vinha da Costa Red (Bairrada)	Portuguese Red	Campolargo	GT_90_Points	Merlot and Syrah join Tinta Roriz in this impressive wine. 58679	Italy	Riva Rocca	89	70	Piedmont	Barolo		Kerin O’Keefe	@kerinokeefe	Claudio Alario 2012 Riva Rocca  (Barolo)	Nebbiolo	Claudio Alario	LT_90_Points	Aromas of oak, coffee, rose, chopped mint and licorice take shape in the glass while the tight palate offers toast, espresso, raspberry jam and a confectionary note. 59182	Italy		88	20	Piedmont	Barbera d'Asti		Kerin O’Keefe	@kerinokeefe	Caldera 2011  Barbera d'Asti	Barbera	Caldera	LT_90_Points	This structured Barbera offers aromas of ripe cherry, raspberry and plum with light toasted notes. It's already extremely accessible and will offer fine drinking pleasure for the near and mid-term.
112660	US		84	20	Oregon	Rogue Valley	Southern Oregon	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Del Rio 2007 Viognier (Rogue Valley)	Viognier	Del Rio	LT_90_Points	This smells— and remarkably it also tastes—like bubble gum, with some pineapple tossed in for good measure. 31077	Italy		86	16	Tuscany	Toscana				Villa Pillo 2005 Syrah (Toscana)	Syrah	Villa Pillo	LT_90_Points	This performed unevenly depending on the bottle. One bottle was rich and drenched in ripe fruit nuances and cheerful herbal notes but the next bottle had much greener tannins.

Iijima		Lakewood 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)	Cabernet Franc	Lakewood	LT_90_Points	At 15.9% abv, this is a monster by Finger Lakes standards, but it's unsurprising perhaps for such a hot vintage. 67164	US		88	28	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Stottle 2013 Merlot (Yakima Valley)	Merlot	Stottle	LT_90_Points	This wine's aromas are quite generous, suggesting herbs, vanilla, baking spice and purple fruit. Its cranberry and cherry flavors are both tart and ripe, supported by soft tannins and a lingering café au lait note. The oak influence gets in the way of the fruit at times, but it's pleasant all the same.
10876	Portugal	Vintage	91		Port			Roger Voss	@vossroger	Andresen 2011 Vintage  (Port)	Port	Andresen	GT_90_Points	Full-bodied and smoky, this is a ripely fruity wine. 47461	France	Collection	89	20	Alsace	Alsace		Anne Krebiehl MW	@AnneInVino	Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Riesling (Alsace)	Riesling	Cave de Ribeauvillé	LT_90_Points	Soft and mellow ripeness rises from the glass, suggesting ripe Mirabelle plum and warm citrus. 33794	New Zealand	Coddington	93	46	Kumeu			Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Kumeu River 2015 Coddington Chardonnay (Kumeu)	Chardonnay	Kumeu River	GT_90_Points	Usually the bigger, more opulent of the Kumeu River Chardonnays, the 2015 version of the Coddington is medium to full in weight, but strikingly focused and vibrant. 36111	Germany		89	11	Mosel			Anna Lee C. Iijima		Member's Mark 2016 Riesling (Mosel)	Riesling	Member's Mark	LT_90_Points	For a value-priced wine (especially considering its large-format bottling), this unassuming Riesling offers a bounty of juicy, fruity enjoyment calibrated with hints of minerality and revitalizing freshness. 107599	Italy	Vigna Monte Danieli	92	70	Veneto	Amarone della Valpolicella Classico				Corte Rugolin 2003 Vigna Monte Danieli  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)	Corvina, Rondinella, Molinara	Corte Rugolin	GT_90_Points	This Amarone is made in a traditional style with aromas of forest berry, red apple, spice and barbecue smoke. 84657	US		88	38	California	Alexander Valley	Sonoma			Dashe Cellars 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Dashe Cellars	LT_90_Points	Fruit and spice star in this bone-dry Cabernet. 61024	Australia	Emeri Sparkling Pinot Grigio	84	10	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	De Bortoli NV Emeri Sparkling Pinot Grigio Sparkling (South Eastern Australia)	Sparkling Blend	De Bortoli	LT_90_Points	Comes across as a bit sweet and soft, with tropical fruit and a lush, creamy texture. 51551	Spain	Furvus	90	34	Catalonia	Montsant		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vinyes Doménech 2007 Furvus Red (Montsant)	Red Blend	Vinyes Doménech	GT_90_Points	Deep, ripe, pure black fruit aromas feature leather and oak accents. 81692	Italy	Uceline	88	29	Piedmont	Monferrato		Kerin O’Keefe	@kerinokeefe	Cascina Castlet 2011 Uceline Uvalino (Monferrato)	Uvalino	Cascina Castlet	LT_90_Points	Made entirely with rare native grape Uvalino, this opens with aromas that recall ripe black plum and vanilla. 124179	France	Le Bourg	90	33	Burgundy	Pouilly-Loché		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Marcel Couturier 2014 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)	Chardonnay	Marcel Couturier	GT_90_Points	Attractive spice and toast aromas add richness to this wine. They lie over the ripe white-stone-fruit flavors that are freshened by citrus. It is still too young to be fully integrated, so wait until 2017 to drink this wine.
14848	Chile	Single Vineyard Cahuil	88	22	Leyda Valley			Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Leyda 2013 Single Vineyard Cahuil Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)	Pinot Noir	Leyda	LT_90_Points	Roasted plum and savory meat aromas are more earthy than bright. Creamy and a touch sticky in feel, this deals flavors that follow the nose, including baked plum, pepper and savory notes. On the finish, it's oak and peppery spice in the lead.
6703	US	Bechthold Vineyard	91	29	California	Lodi	Central Valley	Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Onesta 2012 Bechthold Vineyard Cinsault (Lodi)	Cinsault	Onesta	GT_90_Points	Jammy aromas and concentrated grape and blackberry flavors pack a lot of fruitiness into this full-bodied and velvet-textured wine. 48519	US		92	65	California	Green Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	La Crema 2013 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)	Pinot Noir	La Crema	GT_90_Points	The producer expertly captures the mix of coolness and intensity so true to the appellation, a tangle of brooding black cherry, blackberry and underlying smoke, that's both decadent and succulent on the palate, deeply satisfying in its finish of chocolate and black licorice.
46107	Spain	Gran Reserva	93	77	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Protos 2011 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Protos	GT_90_Points	Full-throttle oak, vanilla, tobacco and smoky blackberry aromas feed into a full, grippy but surprisingly fresh palate. 52918	US	Nielson Vineyard	92	40	California	Santa Maria Valley	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Nielson by Byron 2012 Nielson Vineyard G-S-M (Santa Maria Valley)	G-S-M	Nielson by Byron	GT_90_Points	Very dark in the glass, this inky wine shows aromas of iodine, distilled violets and wound-up black-currant fruit, making the Syrah appear in charge. 104625	US		86	11	California	California	California Other			7 Peaks 2012 Pinot Noir (California)	Pinot Noir	7 Peaks	LT_90_Points	This is a nice value for Pinot Noir. It has some real richness of fruit and smoothness of texture. Flavors of ripe raspberries and dates are offset by fine acidity.
69920	Spain	Marina Espumante F° Espumoso de Fermentación Natural	83	15	Levante	Alicante		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bocopa NV Marina Espumante F° Espumoso de Fermentación Natural Moscatel (Alicante)	Moscatel	Bocopa	LT_90_Points	Musky tropical-fruit aromas carry the nose. The palate is exceedingly foamy and rough, while short flavors of clover, papaya and nutmeg turn bitter then hollow on the finish.
127018	France	Chiesa Nera	93	70	France Other	Vin de France		Roger Voss	@vossroger	Clos Venturi 2013 Chiesa Nera Red (Vin de France)	Red Blend	Clos Venturi	GT_90_Points	Made from a blend of every local red grape imaginable, this is a serious, impressive wine. Its aromas and flavors conjure up the wild mountain scenery around the vineyard, giving black fruits, dense tannins and acidity. The spice at the end is another reminder of its origins. Drink from 2017.
22429	Australia	Bin 28 Kalimna	88	26	South Australia	Barossa Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Penfolds 2006 Bin 28 Kalimna Shiraz (Barossa Valley)	Shiraz	Penfolds	LT_90_Points	Named for the famous Shiraz-growing district at the north end of the Barossa Valley, Penfolds' Kalimna Shiraz is in fact a multiregional South Australian blend that aims to recreate the Kalimna style. paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
64952	Australia		83	8	South Australia	South Australia				Oxford Landing 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Australia)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Oxford Landing	LT_90_Points	Here's a restrained, woodsy interpretation of Cabernet Sauvignon at an accessible price point. It's crisp, with good berry fruit in the mouth and a short finish of barely ripe raspberries. Drink up.
14012	Australia		88	18	South Australia	Adelaide Hills		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Sidewood 2014 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)	Pinot Gris	Sidewood	LT_90_Points	A solid all-around effort, this starts off with hints of struck match and citrus custard, then moves through apple and mandarin flavors. It's medium in body, with a refreshing finish and decent length.

49806	Australia	Scotsdale	91	37	Western Australia	Great Southern		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Howard Park 2013 Scotsdale Cabernet Sauvignon (Great Southern)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Howard Park	GT_90_Points	Dark chocolate and cedar merge easily on the nose of this medium- to full-bodied wine. Those dark, oaky elements are balanced by tart berries on the palate, enhanced by barrel char and oodles of soft tannins on the long finish. Drink now–2025.
70335	Australia		83	17	Western Australia	Margaret River		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Robert Oatley 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)	Sauvignon Blanc	Robert Oatley	LT_90_Points	Overtly green in style, with asparagus notes that are too much for this reviewer. It does have some attractive crushed-stone aromas and an appealing mouthfeel, so it's not without charm.
7932	Australia	The Strapper Grenache-Shiraz-Mataro	90	19	South Australia	Barossa		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Yalumba 2012 The Strapper Grenache-Shiraz-Mataro G-S-M (Barossa)	G-S-M	Yalumba	GT_90_Points	Despite a reported alcohol level that's moderate for its genre, this feels nicely full and rounded on the palate. Hints of vanilla and sarsaparilla accent flavors of cherries, plums and chocolate, while the tannins are supple and creamy in texture. Drink now–2018.
115687	Australia	Taché Méthode Traditionnelle	87	25	Australia Other	South Eastern Australia		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Taltarni 2010 Taché Méthode Traditionnelle  (South Eastern Australia)	Champagne Blend	Taltarni	LT_90_Points	The blend is 53% Chardonnay, 44% Pinot Noir and 3% Pinot Meunier. The wine is a classic traditional-method sparkler, with modest biscuity notes and understated fruit. It's light to medium in body, with a dry, scouring finish.
61114	Australia	The Barry Bros	87	17	South Australia	Clare Valley		Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Jim Barry 2013 The Barry Bros Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (Clare Valley)	Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon	Jim Barry	LT_90_Points	A new wine from the next generation of Barry boys (Tom and Sam), this is a blend of 70% Shiraz and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's a bit herbal, but the bright red-fruit notes win out in the end. Hints of raspberries linger through the finish, whose slightly earthy, gritty tannins would pair well with simple grilled meat dishes—burgers, anyone?

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
18812	US	Archery Summit Vineyard	91	49	California	California	California Other	Joe Czerwinski	@JoeCz	Siduri 1998 Archery Summit Vineyard Pinot Noir (California)	Pinot Noir	Siduri	GT_90_Points	An atypically oaky wine for Siduri, with a rich veneer of French oak overlying black cherries, cola and spice. The intensity builds on the palate, where root beer and black cherries culminate in a long, smoky-spicy finish. Needs a couple of years to pull itself together, but the raw materials are all there.
21119	US		92	25	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Januik 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))	Merlot	Januik	GT_90_Points	A sure-fire crowd-pleaser, this tightly-wound Merlot comes on very Cab-like, but with red fruits more than blue or black. It opens up into a broad mid-palate, showing well-balanced nuances of olive and earth, fresh herb, pepper and licorice. Dense, textural and smoky, it's delicious now or could be cellared for another five or six years.
87493	US	Villa Vista	87	80	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Kuleto Estate 2009 Villa Vista Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Kuleto Estate	LT_90_Points	This 100% Cab is a big, rich wine, and while its power is considerable, it lacks subtlety. There's no question about the intensity of blackberries, cherries and spicy persimmons, unrivaled anywhere in the world. Yet ripeness isn't everything. Hard to see this explosion of fruit going anywhere, so drink soon.
68750	US		88	10	Washington	Washington	Washington Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	14 Hands 2013 Riesling (Washington)	Riesling	14 Hands	LT_90_Points	In just a few years 14 Hands Riesling production has jumped from around 15,000 to more than 700,000 cases. Clearly the brand is doing something that consumers love. This is a fairly dry style, with forward, fruity flavors of ripe orange, apple and apricot. The length and concentration are spot on.
58526	US	Dutton Ranch Shop Block	92	30	California	Green Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)	Pinot Blanc	Dutton-Goldfield	GT_90_Points	Light and fresh, this is a consistently delicious aromatic white from the appellation, a chiseled study in white peach, pear and lilting acidity. Floral in zesty grapefruit, it adds a streak of ginger spice to the finish, with just the right amount of rich body to add weight.
88357	US	Edna Ranch Block 569	90	42	California	Edna Valley	Central Coast			Tolosa 2010 Edna Ranch Block 569 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)	Chardonnay	Tolosa	GT_90_Points	This tiny production Chardonnay shows the hallmarks of Edna Valley. It's bright and brisk in acidity, very clean and dry, and classically pure in lime, kiwi and papaya fruit. Bring on the Dungeness crab and buttered sourdough bread and enjoy.
126385	US	Bacchus Laureate Reserve	91	52	California	Dry Creek Valley	Sonoma			Carol Shelton 2006 Bacchus Laureate Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)	Zinfandel	Carol Shelton	GT_90_Points	With massive fruit and power, this low production (300 case) Zinfandel will make lovers of the Shelton style exult, while others might find it lacking elegance. But there's no doubting the potency of the wild berry, licorice, cola, cedar and spice flavors, which earn this wine its high score.
101613	US	Alder Ridge Vineyard La Montagnette	92	25	Washington	Horse Heaven Hills	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Maison Bleue 2008 Alder Ridge Vineyard La Montagnette Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)	Grenache	Maison Bleue	GT_90_Points	Fragrant and spicy, this opens with green pepper notes and boatloads of prickly/brambly raspberry/strawberry fruit. From a cool vintage, the blend includes 15% Syrah. It's nicely handled, with great penetration and a dancer's precision.
64379	US	Signature	89	45	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Doyenne 2013 Signature Syrah (Yakima Valley)	Syrah	Doyenne	LT_90_Points	A blend of fruit from near equal parts Ciel du Cheval, Grand Ciel and Boushey vineyards, this wine is aromatically brooding at present with notes of coffee, mineral, boysenberry and clove. The palate is more generous, with fruit and barrel flavors that walk hand in hand through the finish.
119261	US		87	20	Oregon	Oregon	Oregon Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	A to Z 2007 Pinot Noir (Oregon)	Pinot Noir	A to Z	LT_90_Points	A to Z has kept a lid on its pricing, and offers one of the best values in Oregon Pinot Noir. Though very young, this wine is soft and forward, and benefits from its early release. It could almost pass for a cru Beaujolais, from the slightly candied cherry fruit right down to the hints of banana that suggest a certain amount of whole cluster fermentation. In any event, it's fruity, lightly detailed with spice, and quite charming, though not as substantial as its 2006 predecessor.
94502	US	Marguerite Vineyard	89	21	California	Anderson Valley		Virginie Boone	@vboone	Philo Ridge 2012 Marguerite Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)	Pinot Gris	Philo Ridge	LT_90_Points	Anderson Valley has always been a hospitable home to Pinot Gris and this 100% tank-fermented, no-malolactic-fermentation beauty is fragrant in orange blossom and honeysuckle, a tangible streak of wet stone zipping throughout. Steely, it settles into apricot and guava before ending with another bite of acidity. A perfect sipping wine, it's also ready for oysters.
18338	US		82	14	New York	Lake Erie	Finger Lakes	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Mazza Chautauqua Cellars 2010 Riesling (Lake Erie)	Riesling	Mazza Chautauqua Cellars	LT_90_Points	Fresh apple and lemon on the palate of this Lake Erie Riesling are pleasant, but overwhelmed by oddly perfumed lemon-pine and floral notes. Simple and a bit savory. Drink now.
113657	US	Estate Reserve	89	52	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Pope Valley Winery 2005 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Pope Valley Winery	LT_90_Points	Ripe, dry and oaky, with powerful black currant and cedar flavors. Shows its youth in the astringency of the tannins, which are fine but very hard. Could be a sleeper. Try after 2011.
84244	US	Fog Veil	93	65	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	La Crema 2015 Fog Veil Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	La Crema	GT_90_Points	Sizzling acidity enlivens the succulent, juicy fruit in this lush expression of the appellation. Made from grapes sourced in the Olivet Lane area, it builds in exotic spiciness, with forest, herb, earth and tea accents that grace the foundation of strawberry and blackberry flavors.
126766	US		91	42	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Dusted Valley 2012 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))	Malbec	Dusted Valley	GT_90_Points	Weinbau, Stone Tree and Dionysus vineyards make up the backbone of this wine. Aromas of dry chocolate, dark plum and sage lead to a densely flavored, hedonistic palate, with full-bodied plum and chocolate flavors that linger.
129862	US	Stephanie's Cuvée	90	25	California	Green Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	River Road 2014 Stephanie's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Green Valley)	Pinot Noir	River Road	GT_90_Points	Earthy forest floor and Asian spice ride atop layers of tangy orange and cherry in this wine defined by lively acidity and a juicy core. Medium bodied in weight and breadth, it finishes in chocolate and vanilla, the oak subtle and supportive.
29646	US	Napanook	88	42	California	Yountville	Napa			Dominus 2005 Napanook Red (Yountville)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Dominus	LT_90_Points	A very nice Cabernet-based wine from Dominus, the '05 Napanook is a shade less elegant than in the last few vintages, but is still a lush, attractive young wine. Filled with the flavors of ripe blackberries, black currants, tar, chocolate, cedar and pepper, its tannins are hard and a little astringent. Give it a few years or serious decanting.
4533	US	Eden Ridge, Barrel Select	82	11	California	Mendocino County		Virginie Boone	@vboone	Truett Hurst 2011 Eden Ridge, Barrel Select Chardonnay (Mendocino County)	Chardonnay	Truett Hurst	LT_90_Points	Simple and tasting of vanilla toffee, this Chardonnay, value-priced for sure, has a finish that's puckeringly sweet.
36540	US	Steak House	85	11	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Original House Wine 2012 Steak House Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Original House Wine	LT_90_Points	It brings a Northwest Cabernet profile of black currant, plum, licorice and light herbs with medium-bodied feel. A touch of sweetness rounds out the finish.
90128	US	Alder Springs Vineyard	88	38	California	Mendocino				Rockroom Winemaking Cooperative 2008 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)	Chardonnay	Rockroom Winemaking Cooperative	LT_90_Points	This oaky, ripe, fruit-forward Chardonnay will appeal to fans of the California style. It's massive in pineapple jam, lemondrop candy and vanilla crème brûlée flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. A little obvious, but delicious.
95859	US		84	20	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Maryhill 2005 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))	Syrah	Maryhill	LT_90_Points	This herbal, tannic Syrah is a serviceable bottle that would be especially good with a simple flank steak. Scents are a mix of grape blossom, cherry and coffee. The wine is solid and one dimensional and finishes with a strong herbal streak.
13124	US	Riesling 12 Hanging Delta Vineyard	89	30	New York	Finger Lakes	Finger Lakes	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Fox Run 2012 Riesling 12 Hanging Delta Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)	Riesling	Fox Run	LT_90_Points	The 12 Hanging Delta Vineyard is a plusher, more decadent expression of grapefruit, mandarin orange and stone fruit flavors common to all of Fox Run's 2012 geology series. It's lip-smacking with sweetness and exceptionally light in body yet maintains an elegant, vibrant style. The finish is tinged by an earthier touch of smoked nuts and slate.
16703	US		88	14	California	Mendocino County				Bonterra 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)	Chardonnay	Bonterra	LT_90_Points	Shows the purity of flavor and structure that Bonterra wines are famous for. Ultraclean and racy in acidity, this Chardonnay stars ripe varietal flavors of pineapples, oranges and limes. A touch of oak adds welcome richness.
119328	US	Momtazi Vineyard	88	23	Oregon	McMinnville	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Maysara 2013 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Gris (McMinnville)	Pinot Gris	Maysara	LT_90_Points	Finished (apparently) off-dry, this seems to show some residual sugar in a leesy, yeasty style. The fruit suggests pears and cotton candy, with juicy acidity supporting the sweetness. Don't look for your standard dry Pinot Gris, but what's here is generous and enjoyable.
50231	US	Estate	87	32	California	Paso Robles	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Sculpterra 2012 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)	Merlot	Sculpterra	LT_90_Points	Leather, dried cherries, plums, dark chocolate and sagebrush aromas are woven into a decent if not entirely lively nose. Lots of chopped fresh and dried herbs arise once sipped, along with gravel, black fruit and sticky tannins.
129410	US	PreVail West Face	89	70	California	Alexander Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Ferrari-Carano 2014 PreVail West Face Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Alexander Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah	Ferrari-Carano	LT_90_Points	Cabernet Sauvignon dominates in this 66% to 35% blend, with both varieties grown on the producer's Lookout Mountain estate. Full bodied, it features stewed plum, dark chocolate and mocha, with a base of cedar and clove. Extended tannins make it fleshy and full.
78956	US	The Expedition	88	16	Washington	Horse Heaven Hills	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Canoe Ridge 2015 The Expedition Red (Horse Heaven Hills)	Red Blend	Canoe Ridge	LT_90_Points	This wine is just over two-thirds Merlot, the balance in Syrah, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Dark plum, coffee, bittersweet chocolate and spice aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors backed by plump tannins. It goes down easy.
101632	US		89	18	California	Paso Robles	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Robert Hall 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)	Zinfandel	Robert Hall	LT_90_Points	Opting to focus on the herbal side of California's historic grape, this wine shows dark cranberry on the nose but lets the chaparral, thyme and cola do the heavy lifting. The palate is dominated by shrub character, with wild mint, sage and oregano flavors seasoning the dried-berry fruit.
16286	US	Copeland Vineayard	87	28	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Two Mountain 2012 Copeland Vineayard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Two Mountain	LT_90_Points	Aromas are dominated by oak with accents of vanilla, cocoa and woodspice along with cranberries, rose hips, herbs and raspberries. The palate is elegant with herb and cherry flavors that lead to a tart, cranberry-filled finish.
40945	US	Sweet Rosé	86	14	California	California	California Other			Korbel NV Sweet Rosé Sparkling (California)	Sparkling Blend	Korbel	LT_90_Points	Like the label says, this Pinot Noir-based blend of multiple varieties is sugary sweet, with raspberry, vanilla and toast flavors. It's a refreshing and easy to drink.
50079	US	Estate Grown	90	38	California	Napa Valley	Napa	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Cuvaison 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)	Pinot Noir	Cuvaison	GT_90_Points	A light, straightforward and focused wine, 100% varietal, this offers cranberry, mushroom and a complexity of tannin and oak. High acidity dances around fresh layers of strawberry and raspberry on the palate, with a grippy, cinnamon-spiced finish.
122728	US	West Block	91	50	Oregon	Willamette Valley	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Patton Valley 2012 West Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)	Pinot Noir	Patton Valley	GT_90_Points	This block is singled out in order to present a wine that has received full western exposure throughout the growing season. That's reflected in the ripeness and fullness on the palate. It's a fruit-driven vintage, and this matches it perfectly with strawberry preserves, enhanced with streaks of cola, sassafras and coffee grounds. Mineral-drenched acids provide the perfect support.
91557	US		88	14	California	Mendocino County		Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Bonterra 2014 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)	Chardonnay	Bonterra	LT_90_Points	A rather deep, brassy color and very buttery aromas make this wine stand out. The flavors are also buttery, appley and rich, while the texture is creamy and the body almost full.
21837	US	White Delight	80	30	California	Sierra Pelona Valley	South Coast	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Reyes NV White Delight White (Sierra Pelona Valley)	White Blend	Reyes	LT_90_Points	A sweet, high-fueled blend of Chardonnay, Muscat Blanc and old-vine Trebbiano from a newly approved appellation called the Sierra Pelona Valley, north of Los Angeles, this wine has peach and lemon peel hiding behind a lathering of oak.
85399	US	Forgotten Hills	89	40	Washington	Walla Walla Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Waters 2005 Forgotten Hills Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))	Syrah	Waters	LT_90_Points	This 100% Syrah is tight, young and sappy, and the tart fruit tastes of salmonberries and blueberries, with hints of mineral and flint. Call it a Euro style, with that sort of grip and detail. It rewards airtime and attention, yet still hints at a slightly green edge.
114712	US		88	22	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Gramercy 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))	Viognier	Gramercy	LT_90_Points	This wine offers bright aromas of watermelon and cherry Jolly Ranger. It drinks dry with candied fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of texture and richness.
129140	US	Estate	92	50	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Signorello 2005 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Signorello	GT_90_Points	Shows all the hallmarks of a wine that will improve with mid-term aging. The flavors leap out now, and are all about ripe, crushed blackberries, red and black currants, anise and sweet, smoky cedar. Yet there's a tannic interference that's a little hard and astringent. Decant, if you have to open, but should hit its stride after 2009.
34955	US	Antagonist Elephant Mountain	91	45	Washington	Yakima Valley	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	J. Bookwalter 2014 Antagonist Elephant Mountain Syrah (Yakima Valley)	Syrah	J. Bookwalter	GT_90_Points	This site is seeing an increasing number of vineyard-designated bottles made from it. This one brings brooding aromas of dark fruit, licorice and spice that lead to full-bodied, almost jammy fruit flavors. It shows a lot of hedonism but retains its impeccable balance.
28647	US	Old Vine	94	39	Oregon	Columbia Valley (OR)	Oregon Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Sineann 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (OR))	Zinfandel	Sineann	GT_90_Points	Old-vine Oregon Zinfandel is not common; in fact, this is all of them. From the Pines Vineyard, planted around a century ago, revived in the 1980s, these wines have a power and unique presence that sets them apart from Zin from anywhere else. Ultraripe fruit flavors of strawberry and raspberry jam, alcohol above 15%, amazing density and beautifully managed tannins, with some sweet grain flavors that say “old vines.”
2667	US	Vintage Brut	90	45	California	Yountville	Napa			Chandon 2008 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Yountville)	Sparkling Blend	Chandon	GT_90_Points	This sparkling wine is one of the best from Chandon in years. There's a soft refinement to the mousse, making it just as good as its more expensive rivals. Shows complex flavors of yeast, limes, oranges, vanilla and honey.
80808	US	Ingle Vineyard	86	18	New York	Finger Lakes	Finger Lakes	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Heron Hill 2008 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)	Cabernet Franc	Heron Hill	LT_90_Points	Sweet and brambly, Heron Hill's Ingle Vineyard Cab Franc is fragrant with aromas of cherry pie filling, vanilla spice and dried, ripe wood. The palate is dry and lean, but quite concentrated in fruit with a pleasantly tart raspberry finish.
11371	US	Estate Vineyard	81	44	California	Sonoma Valley	Sonoma			Beltane Ranch 2012 Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)	Zinfandel	Beltane Ranch	LT_90_Points	This Zin is actually a field blend including Petite Sirah, Alicante and Carignane. It's sweet with raspberry jam notes, but also a bit vegetal with flavors of asparagus.
57526	US	Stainless	88	18	California	Central Coast	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Chamisal Vineyards 2013 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)	Chardonnay	Chamisal Vineyards	LT_90_Points	Light, bright and refreshing, it offers pear spritzer, lime zest and a hint of guava on the nose, followed by citrus rind, light papaya and apple juice on the palate. It makes a nice bridge between the richness of Chardonnay and crispness of Sauvignon Blanc.
37519	US		88	10	California	Mendocino County		Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Castle Rock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)	Sauvignon Blanc	Castle Rock	LT_90_Points	An attractive floral, appley aroma and generous, ripe apple and herb flavors give this medium-bodied wine plenty of personality.
48309	US	Tomas Imogene's Vineyard	85	52	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Prager 2006 Tomas Imogene's Vineyard Port (Napa Valley)	Port	Prager	LT_90_Points	Smooth and velvety, with chocolate-cherry flavors, but the sweetness tails off quickly, disappointing the palate. Good and sound, but lacks the continuing richness you want in a true Port-style wine, especially at this price.
62371	US	Barrouge	90	40	California	Napa Valley	Napa			Barlow 2005 Barrouge Red (Napa Valley)	Bordeaux-style Red Blend	Barlow	GT_90_Points	This is Barlow's Bordeaux blend. Based on Cabernet Sauvignon, it's a beautiful wine, dry and balanced and fully ready to drink now, although it will take some years of cellaring. With fine acidity and tannins, it displays elegant flavors of currants and cassis, with rich edges of mocha and cedar.
39413	US		92	35	Oregon	Oregon	Oregon Other	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Penner-Ash 2015 Viognier (Oregon)	Viognier	Penner-Ash	GT_90_Points	Viognier is a particular strength at Penner-Ash, and here, once again, the challenge of balancing the grape's high-wire sensibility is met with ease. Firm and compact initially, it blooms with delicious flavors of lemon pastry, hints of mint, and lemongrass. It's full bodied, poised and steers clear of both bitterness and burn.
102079	US	Casscles Vineyards	87	25	New York	New York	New York Other	Anna Lee C. Iijima		Hudson-Chatham 2014 Casscles Vineyards Chelois (New York)	Chelois	Hudson-Chatham	LT_90_Points	Concentrated but crisp black-plum and cherry flavors are accented by savory hints of mushroom, toast and spice in this surprisingly elegant Chelois, a French-American hybrid variety. Slightly puckering acidity lends balance to a rich fleshy mouthfeel. Fine tannins frame a taut finish. Drink now through 2020.
92928	US		89	50	Washington	Red Mountain	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	@wawinereport	Fidelitas 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)	Cabernet Sauvignon	Fidelitas	LT_90_Points	This wine is a blend of fruit from Quintessence, Red Heaven, Fidelitas Estate and Shaw vineyards. The aromas are wound up tightly at present but with coaxing reveal notes of French oak spices, black cherry and black currant. The flavors show a surprising amount of restraint, with a pleasing cranberry tartness and a lick of tannins.
68775	US		81	12	California	California	California Other			Red Truck 2006 Pinot Noir (California)	Pinot Noir	Red Truck	LT_90_Points	Simple and harsh in texture, this Pinot has the variety's silky texture, but not much else going for it. The flavors are minty and green, with just the barest suggestion of cherries.
6580	US	Old Vines Dedication Series #26	94	84	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Woodward Canyon 2006 Old Vines Dedication Series #26 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cabernet Sauvignon	Woodward Canyon	GT_90_Points	This is a mix of 56% Sagemoor and 41% Champoux Cabernet, with a 3% splash of estate Petit Verdot. It's detailed in the manner of a Pauillac, thick cassis fruit with deep veins of iron, cedar, licorice and a just a hint of silage. The fruit is dark and dense, but with breathing you'll find it begins to open into a splendid blend of black cherry, cassis and mountain berry flavor. Woodward Canyon's red wines age beautifully, but if drunk young give them a lot of breathing time.
100868	US	Reserve	91	30	California	Paso Robles	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Villa San Juliette 2013 Reserve Alicante Bouschet (Paso Robles)	Alicante Bouschet	Villa San Juliette	GT_90_Points	Rich caramel and fudge tones mix with inviting crushed purple flowers, baked blackberries and vanilla on the nose of this bottling that features a red-fleshed grape rarely used alone. The palate is sharper than the lavish nose suggests, with fresh crushed elderberries and dried fennel spice.
5548	US	Van der Kamp Vineyard	90	24	California	Sonoma Mountain	Sonoma			Novy 2010 Van der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Meunier (Sonoma Mountain)	Pinot Meunier	Novy	GT_90_Points	Virtually identical with Pinot Noir, and quite a good one at that. Shows cool-climate influence in the translucent color, vital acidity and pure flavors of raspberries and persimmons, accented with smoky oak.
18411	US	Lucie	88	60	California	Russian River Valley	Sonoma	Virginie Boone	@vboone	Bacio Divino 2012 Lucie Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)	Pinot Noir	Bacio Divino	LT_90_Points	This is a young, meaty Pinot, a bottle of substantial red cherry, earthy mushroom and soil that's bright and layered with a heartiness to the texture and finish. The back label mentions that the grapes were sourced from Bacigalupi Vineyards, a longstanding star in the Russian River Valley.

Iijima		Silver Thread 2013 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)	Riesling	Silver Thread	LT_90_Points	Savory shades of dust and pressed apple contrast fresh lemon and blossom in this off-dry Riesling. It's starkly acidic, but plush tangerine and peach flavors round out the midpalate. Finishes moderately long on a earthy mineral note.
45479	US	Haiku Ranch	88	18	California	Mendocino		Jim Gordon	@gordone_cellars	Philo Ridge 2014 Haiku Ranch Chardonnay (Mendocino)	Chardonnay	Philo Ridge	LT_90_Points	Substantial and smooth, this full-bodied wine starts slowly with mild fruit and butter aromas, then turns up the volume on the palate with ripe pear, vanilla and nutmeg. It conveys a feeling of oak-aged richness although it was tank-fermented.
61357	US	Topolos Vineyard Mr. Beast	83	25	California	Sonoma Mountain	Sonoma			Barber 2012 Topolos Vineyard Mr. Beast Zinfandel (Sonoma Mountain)	Zinfandel	Barber	LT_90_Points	This bottling has had its problems over the years, and while Barber's '12 is their best effort to date, it's still troubled. The fruit is overripe, with raisin and prune notes and bitter raisin-skin tannins. Still, you can gulp it down with barbecue.
33975	US	Doerner Vyd	86	30	Oregon	Umpqua Valley	Southern Oregon			Secret House 1998 Doerner Vyd Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)	Pinot Noir	Secret House	LT_90_Points	Light and bright, a shade darker than a hearty Rhône rosé, this cherry- and strawberry-flavored pacer displays saddle leather and earth notes that provide interest and depth. Fairly high in acidity, and with brisk, lightly peppery tannins, this would be great with cheese or spicy hors d’oeuvres.
81111	US	The Chard	87	15	California	California	California Other			Cosentino 2009 The Chard Chardonnay (California)	Chardonnay	Cosentino	LT_90_Points	Good price for a Chardonnay this rich and satisfying. It's oaky and ripe and flamboyant in orange and pineapple fruit, yet a brisk cut of acidity and minerality saves it from being too sweet.
70362	US	Dundee Hills Select	89	45	Oregon	Dundee Hills	Willamette Valley	Paul Gregutt	@paulgwine 	Torii Mor 2014 Dundee Hills Select Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)	Pinot Noir	Torii Mor	LT_90_Points	Six barrels—one each from six vineyards—comprise this cuvée. It's soft and silky, with pretty cherry fruit and a touch of herb. The finish continues smooth and supple, with a suggestion of caramel.
101273	US		86	16	California	Ventura County	Central Coast	Matt Kettmann	@mattkettmann	Clos des Amis 2016 Rosé (Ventura County)	Rosé	Clos des Amis	LT_90_Points	This pink blend of Mourvèdre and Grenache shows rosy aromas as well as a bitter orange scent and yeasty qualities. The palate is light in both flavor and texture but makes for a refreshing hot day sipper.

paragraphs.title: Compare Wines from Different Countries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Compare wines from Different Countries
-- Hint: Choose different countries from the drop down

SELECT * FROM WineReviews130K_bin WHERE COUNTRY = ${COUNTRY='Germany', 'Germany'|'Spain'|'Chile'|'US'|'Argentine'|'Italy'|'Australia'};

msg.data:
ID	COUNTRY	DESIGNATION	POINTS	PRICE	PROVINCE	REGION_1	REGION_2	TASTER_NAME	TASTER_TWITTER_HANDLE	TITLE	VARIETY	WINERY	POINTS_BIN	DESCRIPTION
30894	Spain	Conde de Valdemar Finca Alto Cantabria	82	15	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde de Valdemar Finca Alto Cantabria Viura (Rioja)	Viura	Bodegas Valdemar	LT_90_Points	Maderized aromas of applesauce and dust are not terribly welcoming. Meanwhile, the palate is mild and tastes nutty, like soft apples and spice. This is acceptable barrel-fermented Viura but it lacks freshness and character.
121061	Spain	Navia	90	32	Galicia	Rías Baixas		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	La Caña 2014 Navia Albariño (Rías Baixas)	Albariño	La Caña	GT_90_Points	A clear shot of oak hits first on the nose, followed by melon and mild citrus notes. Despite its age, this is still fresh and in balance due to good core acidity. Yeasty, lightly resiny flavors come with notes of briny citrus, while an oaky-tasting finish is steady due to the aforementioned acidity. Drink now.
69367	Spain		88	16	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Gotín del Risc 2010 Mencía (Bierzo)	Mencía	Gotín del Risc	LT_90_Points	Charred aromas are draped over spicy, leafy berry aromas. This oak-blackened Mencía is wiry and bright in feel, with lightly green, mildly herbal and minty flavors of burnt berry and smoked meat. An herbal-tasting finish is good in feel.
106492	Spain	Garnacha-Tempranillo	85	12	Northern Spain	Navarra		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Ochoa 2008 Garnacha-Tempranillo Red (Navarra)	Red Blend	Ochoa	LT_90_Points	Hefty and rubbery on the bouquet, with black-fruit aromas and some dustiness. The palate is fresh feeling, with full acidity and a mildly stretched set of lively berry and roasted flavors. Comes up a bit short and hollow on the finish, but good all totaled.
32924	Spain	Lady of Spain Brut	88	14	Catalonia	Cava		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Paul Cheneau NV Lady of Spain Brut Sparkling (Cava)	Sparkling Blend	Paul Cheneau	LT_90_Points	Maybe you've seen the cool yellow wrapper with a shapely woman that   adorns this versatile Cava, but what's inside merits attention as well. After melon, banana and spice aromas the palate takes over with citrus and mango   flavors. Distinguished due to its solid mouthfeel and good natural carbonation. Pour on its own, with food or in a mimosa.
110304	Spain	Javier San Pedro Crianza	87	21	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vallobera 2009 Javier San Pedro Crianza  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Vallobera	LT_90_Points	Brambly, leathery and roasted on the nose, this features raspberry and plum aromas in the backdrop. It feels fresh, clampy and forward, with a mix of leather, herb, plum, tomato and spice flavors. A solid wine with traditional Rioja character.
94572	Spain	Alea Tempranillo	85	11	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Marques de Griñon 2009 Alea Tempranillo  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Marques de Griñon	LT_90_Points	Rubber and leather aromas create a slightly mulchy bouquet. The palate is snappy and acidic, with earthy, leafy red-fruit flavors. Finishes dry with crisp acidity and a touch of oak-related vanilla. Standard fare.
10669	Spain		84	18	Galicia	Rías Baixas		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Don Olegario 2011 Albariño (Rías Baixas)	Albariño	Don Olegario	LT_90_Points	This smells stalky and past its prime, but it's not stinky or maderized. The palate is fleshy in feel and oily in sensation, with bitter citrus flavors and pithy notes. Neither vital nor fresh on the finish.
84190	Spain	Viña Real Crianza	88	18	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	CVNE 2004 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	CVNE	LT_90_Points	Quite ripe for a traditional crianza. The bouquet starts out on the stewy side but soon sheds its weight to reveal flavors of blackberry, black cherry and earth. The mouthfeel is a bit creamy due to the wine's mild oak and overall ripeness. Drink now through 2010.
94695	Spain	Prestigio	85	27	Northern Spain	Cigales		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Val de Los Frailes 2004 Prestigio Tempranillo (Cigales)	Tempranillo	Val de Los Frailes	LT_90_Points	Stretched and woody on the nose, with not much fruit. It feels wide, grabby and tannic, with leathery, herbal berry flavors. Grabby on the finish, this is still quite tannic and a bit tough on the palate.
118927	Spain	Monte Clavijo	85	10	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Criadores de Rioja 2006 Monte Clavijo  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Criadores de Rioja	LT_90_Points	An ordinary but competent Rioja. The fruit is light but young and fresh; the palate touches on raspberry and plum. A bit of mineral and natural bitterness work the finish, and overall this is a no-complaints kind of $10 wine.
118844	Spain	Crianza	90	32	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Protos 2009 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Protos	GT_90_Points	Traditional oak-based aromas of mint, dill, tobacco, vanilla and coconut sit on top of tarry black-fruit scents. In the mouth, this is a snappy, tight, structured wine with flavors of oak, coffee, licorice, spice and blackberry. It's stylish on the finish, with toasty, peppery flavors that linger for a good, long while.
20147	Spain	Brut	83	11	Catalonia	Cava		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Mas Fi NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)	Sparkling Blend	Mas Fi	LT_90_Points	Faint aromas suggest white gumdrop. This feels flat, with flavors of spicy, yeasty apple and a soft, fleeting finish.
116003	Spain	Real de Aragon	85	11	Northern Spain	Calatayud		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Pagos Familia Langa 2009 Real de Aragon Garnacha (Calatayud)	Garnacha	Pagos Familia Langa	LT_90_Points	Dark, meaty and ripe, the bouqiet has a strong wave of herb and carob notes. It feels grabby almost to the point of cloying, with heavily oaked flavors of roasted black fruit and milk chocolate. This is oak dominated, but full and chocolaty.
48567	Spain	Prado Enea Gran Reserva	93	63	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Muga 2001 Prado Enea Gran Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Muga	GT_90_Points	It's not easy to find mature Rioja from a great winery and a great year. This is all that; it smells of tobacco, earth and dried fruits. The palate is lively and not dying, while the flavors of cherry, raisin and marzipan are spot on. Compact and long on the finish, indicating that it still has another 10–15 years in it.
87125	Spain	Alabaster	97	227	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Teso La Monja 2012 Alabaster  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Teso La Monja	GT_90_Points	Gorgeous from head to toe, this saturated Toro heavyweight sets a new bar for this winery and the region as a whole. Ribald blackberry aromas are toasty and carry a strong note of crushed stones. Cassis, black plum and blackberry flavors are complex and inspired, while the finish tastes of chocolaty oak, blackened toast and a black-fruit potpourri supported by just the right amount of acidity. Drink from 2017–2030.
85745	Spain		89	25	Northern Spain	Getariako Txakolina		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Zudugarai 2014 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)	Hondarrabi Zuri	Zudugarai	LT_90_Points	Aromas of children's vitamins, corn stalk and white peach set up a lemony stony zesty palate with lemon and nectarine flavors. A stony crisp cleansing finish does the job while not faltering.
80153	Spain	Crianza	88	22	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Finca La Emperatriz 2010 Crianza  (Rioja)	Tempranillo Blend	Finca La Emperatriz	LT_90_Points	Spicy generic berry aromas come with an herbal component and a note of licorice root. This feels tight and compact, but not overly ripe. Berry fruit flavors are herbal and the slightest bit green, with a black-pepper note in front of a rubbery finish with clamping tannins.
56115	Spain		89	20	Northern Spain	Bierzo		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Pazo Pondal 2015 Godello (Bierzo)	Godello	Pazo Pondal	LT_90_Points	This Godello feels composed and solid. Dry white-fruit aromas are reticent and oily. Flavors of peach and golden apple finish with stability and a sense of class. Drink now.
60582	Spain	Brut Reserva Selección de la Familia	88	16	Catalonia	Cava		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Lonia NV Brut Reserva Selección de la Familia Sparkling (Cava)	Sparkling Blend	Lonia	LT_90_Points	Solid white-fruit aromas blend with a grassy note of hay as well as dusty floral scents. A smooth mouthfeel is devoid of edginess, while friendly white peach, melon and apple flavors are round on the finish.
2469	Spain	Premium Fino	90	16	Andalucia	Jerez		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Delgado Zuleta NV Premium Fino Sherry (Jerez)	Sherry	Delgado Zuleta	GT_90_Points	Intense, nutty, yeasty aromas are briny and a touch creamy. This has a tight, pure, round palate with salty nectarine, apricot and nut flavors. Walnut oil and white pepper notes grace a direct, lively finish.
53855	Spain	Columna	84	17	Galicia	Rías Baixas		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Compañia de Vinos del Atlántico 2013 Columna Albariño (Rías Baixas)	Albariño	Compañia de Vinos del Atlántico	LT_90_Points	Briny, pickled aromas come with hints of citrus and flower blossom. This fast-aging Albariño is melony in feel, but it lacks the variety's patented kick and acidity. As a result, peach and apricot flavors are fleshy and chunky.
65402	Spain	Sirsell	91	30	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Capafons-Ossó 2006 Sirsell Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Capafons-Ossó	GT_90_Points	Reedy, attractive, classy aromas of red fruits, tobacco and fine herbs are like a red carpet entering the gala. The mouth is structured and tannic but not hard or biting; flavors of red berry, plum and cherry lean towards sweet, while the finish is long, medicinal and on the money. Drink now through 2014.
121657	Spain	Castillo de Gormaz Crianza	87	20	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Viña Gormaz 2004 Castillo de Gormaz Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Viña Gormaz	LT_90_Points	Spicy, bretty and leathery; this type of wine represents Ribera in a traditional, no-tricks light. Air only helps it show its best attributes, which revolve around meaty black fruit and herbal accents. It's chewy, sort of tannic and finishes with flavors of moss and jerky. Good for near-term consumption.
57367	Spain		89	20	Northern Spain	Navarra		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Artadi 2014 Garnacha (Navarra)	Garnacha	Artadi	LT_90_Points	This wine's earthy cherry and plum aromas come with a hint of milk chocolate. The palate is edged with rubbery tannins, its savory, lightly salted plum flavors growing jammier and more fig-like as it breathes. A textbook fruit-forward Grenache.
38617	Spain	Capitoso	88	16	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Altanza 2007 Capitoso  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Altanza	LT_90_Points	Good, pure, dark and teetering on powerful, with strong, rich black plum aromas. The mouth is staunch and balanced, with full dark fruit flavors of blackberry along with bitter chocolate. Solid and clean throughout. A winner in its price range.
121961	Spain	Viña del Olivo	90	130	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Contino 2008 Viña del Olivo  (Rioja)	Red Blend	Contino	GT_90_Points	Berry, rubber, exotic spice, earth and toast aromas work in harmony. This blend of Tempranillo and Graciano is packed with acidity, structured tannins, oak and red-fruit flavors of plum and raspberry. It's only on the finish where you get richer notes of prune and pastry. Drink through 2022.
125747	Spain		88	28	Northern Spain	Navarra		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Pasolasmonjas 2008 Garnacha (Navarra)	Garnacha	Pasolasmonjas	LT_90_Points	Savory and exotic on the nose, with blueberry and cardamom. The palate strikes hard with tannic clamp and reduction. Flavors run lemony and herbal, with star anise and cardamom mixing with berry fruit. Clacky and tight on the finish, but serious and complex. 350 cases made; drink now through 2012.
26857	Spain	Marionette	90	18	Levante	Jumilla		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Ego Bodegas 2014 Marionette Red (Jumilla)	Red Blend	Ego Bodegas	GT_90_Points	Rich berry and graham-cracker aromas announce a ripe, easygoing Monastrell-Syrah blend. Chewy and slightly sinewy in feel, this offers heaps of tasty but creamy oak and vanilla to go with spicy, herbal berry fruit. A creamy, thick finish is fitting for a warm-climate wine like this.
60569	Spain	Volvoreta Probus	88	25	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Nuntia Vini 2005 Volvoreta Probus  (Toro)	Tinta de Toro	Nuntia Vini	LT_90_Points	Crushed floral aromas, berry-infused tea and cherry candy aromas give this wine a sweet profile. The palate, however, is anything but. It pounds with toasty black fruit, licorice and fiery menthol. The feel is a bit tannic but not terribly harsh, so maybe another three to five years will serve it well.
35486	Spain	El Telar	90	78	Levante	Alicante		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vinessens 2012 El Telar Monastrell (Alicante)	Monastrell	Vinessens	GT_90_Points	Heady raisiny aromas smell sweet, savory and a bit like animal fur. This is pinching and hot on the palate, which shouldn't surprise at 15.5% abv. Savory roasted blackberry and baking-spice flavors end with peppery heat and hard tannins. Drink this sizzling varietal Monastrell through 2023.
34409	Spain	Kios Elite	91	27	Central Spain	Vino de la Tierra de Castilla		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Tikalo 2004 Kios Elite Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)	Tempranillo	Tikalo	GT_90_Points	Earthy and rich Tempranillo with hints of fresh herbs, tomato, balsam wood and spice in addition to roasted plum on the bouquet. The palate is tannic and big but shows a ton of fruit and classy flavors of roasted berry, dark chocolate, licorice and dried spices. Heady on the finish and aggressive, but loaded with flavor, kick and quality. Drink now through 2014.
30684	Spain		85	11	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	El Coto 2012 Viura (Rioja)	Viura	El Coto	LT_90_Points	Yeasty, dusty aromas of apple and melon lead to a plump, almost flat feeling palate with generic flavors of peach, apple and melon. The finish has a soft, mealy, slightly creamy and flat feel along with modest flavors of white fruits.
10192	Spain	Reserva	87	30	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Fernández de Piérola 2004 Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Fernández de Piérola	LT_90_Points	Opens with leathery aromas suggestive of animal hide along with a leafy element and nuttiness. Airing reveals a compact, medium-intensity palate with baked, roasted, fairly sweet berry flavors. Finishes sweet and mildly leafy.
124022	Spain	Ponsalet Jove	83	16	Levante	Valencia		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Daniel Belda 2013 Ponsalet Jove Monastrell (Valencia)	Monastrell	Daniel Belda	LT_90_Points	This Monastrell opens with resiny, lactic aromas and a strong note of rubber. It's big, blocky and chunky in feel, while the flavor profile revolves around briny plum and rubber.
36708	Spain	Satinela Medium-Sweet	84	9	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Marqués de Cáceres 2007 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)	White Blend	Marqués de Cáceres	LT_90_Points	If you catch this wine young and properly chilled, it isn't that bad. It's very sweet and sugary, with candied melon, mango and citrus flavors. Then it gets more tropical on the finish, with ending notes of banana and mango. On the verge of tasting fake but not quite.
122076	Spain	Lui Selection Crianza	92	24	Northern Spain	Toro		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Abelis Carthago 2012 Lui Selection Crianza  (Toro)	Tempranillo	Abelis Carthago	GT_90_Points	Full, dark aromas of varied black fruits set up a rich, chewy palate that's stern but not too hard. Flavors of black fruits and oaky spice are meaty as a whole, while the finish is lush, round and only slightly gripping. This Toro amounts to a great value. Drink through 2020.
111778	Spain	Selecció	90	60	Catalonia	Priorat		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Clos Berenguer del Molar 2012 Selecció Red (Priorat)	Red Blend	Clos Berenguer del Molar	GT_90_Points	A dense, baked, raisiny nose is ultra ripe but also a bit flabby and damp-smelling. A big, grabby mouth-filler, this offers baked, oaky flavors of blackberry, fig and chocolate, finishing with lingering chocolate and prune. Drink this chunky, superripe Priorat sooner rather than later.
59426	Spain	Reserva	85		Central Spain	Valdepeñas		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Viña Albali 2001 Reserva Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)	Tempranillo	Viña Albali	LT_90_Points	Lots of oak results in aromas of bacon, charred beef, cinnamon and heavy berry fruit. The wine is big and clangy, but not harsh. The flavors of berries mixed with greens and vanilla are nervy, while in the end the wine shows a solid mouthfeel and decent structure.
48787	Spain	Blanc Selecció	86	17	Catalonia	Penedès		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Huguet de Can Feixes 2014 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)	White Blend	Huguet de Can Feixes	LT_90_Points	Aromas of peach pit are neutral except for some oily notes. This multigrape blend feels plump, oily and propped up by solid acidity. Pithy flavors of grapefruit and melon are slightly bitter on the finish.
68621	Spain	Hoya de Cadenas Reserva	85	10	Levante	Utiel-Requena		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Vicente Gandia 2011 Hoya de Cadenas Reserva Tempranillo (Utiel-Requena)	Tempranillo	Vicente Gandia	LT_90_Points	Earthy, leathery aromas of plum and berry are a touch rustic. This feels rubbery and raw, but fresh. Dry, earthy plum flavors are limited, while the finish is short, with a tight, chalky feel.
113225	Spain	Prestigio Crianza	89	32	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Emina 2014 Prestigio Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Emina	LT_90_Points	Leathery blackberry, vanilla and tobacco aromas include a gritty burnt note that's not entirely welcome. This feels full and oaky, with good balance. Oak-based flavors of vanilla and mocha sit atop black-fruit notes, while this is balanced yet tannic on the finish, with a lingering flavor of vanilla. Drink from 2018–2023.
117916	Spain	I Unacepa	92	49	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Valduero 2012 I Unacepa  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	Valduero	GT_90_Points	Ripe, baked black-fruit aromas go heavy on the raisin and prune, with a hint of spice cake thrown in. On the palate, this is saturated and a bit thick. Baked berry, cassis and creamy oak flavors finish lush and chewy, with flavors of oak grain and chocolate. Drink now through 2020.
97120	Spain	Gn	82	21	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Casa Primicia 2008 Gn  (Rioja)	Garnacha	Casa Primicia	LT_90_Points	A rusty color is a give-away that this Garnacha isn't in the best shape. The nose smells of cotton candy and Kool-Aid. The feel is flat, grabby and tannic, while the flavors are scattershot, with brown sugar notes and dry leafiness on the finish.
43425	Spain		89	65	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Astrales 2013  Ribera del Duero	Tinto Fino	Astrales	LT_90_Points	Black cherry and cassis aromas are bold but basic. This feels fiercely tannic and astringent. Meaty flavors of cherry and black plum end with dried berry notes, prune and rock-hard tannic bite. Give this more time if possible, but like many 2013s it might never soften and improve.
52878	Spain	Tinto Viñas Viejas	92	68	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	García Figuero 2013 Tinto Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)	Tempranillo	García Figuero	GT_90_Points	Smoky hickory and meat aromas overshadow this wine's berry scents. On the palate, it rattles about like an untied load. Berry and black plum flavors come with more than enough oak, which is reflected on the toasty, char-laced finish. Drink 2019–2026.
60153	Spain		84	10	Central Spain	Vino de la Tierra de Castilla		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Tapeña 2007 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)	Verdejo	Tapeña	LT_90_Points	Apple and modest dusty white-fruit aromas are about all you'll get from the neutral bouquet, while the palate is sweet and a little candied, with apple and mango flavors. Fleshy and chunky, but good enough to enjoy in a casual setting. Probably a good base wine for white sangria.
124797	Spain	Reserva	88	25	Northern Spain	Rioja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Sierra Cantabria 2007 Reserva  (Rioja)	Tempranillo	Sierra Cantabria	LT_90_Points	The nose on this reserva is roasted and meaty, with dark berry accents. The palate delivers a flush feel and volume along with flavors of roasted plum, herbal raspberry and salt. There's tobacco and pimiento on the finish, and for a subpar vintage the wine is still very good. Drink now through 2017.
42637	Spain		87	7	Northern Spain	Campo de Borja		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Crucillon 2009 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)	Garnacha	Crucillon	LT_90_Points	A perfectly solid Garnacha with pepper, bright red fruit and a touch of country style to the bouquet despite its pedestrian price. The palate is bright and tastes of plum and red berry, while the feel is good and the finish fruity and lively. What inexpensive red wine should be.
20572	Spain	Old Vine	86	10	Northern Spain	Cariñena		Michael Schachner	@wineschach	Valcantara 2012 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)	Garnacha	Valcantara	LT_90_Points	Pinched and wiry-smelling on the nose, this Garnacha comes around with earthy red-berry aromas in front of a full, chunky, fairly oaky palate. Flavors of blackberry and vanilla are good but common, while the finish is dense but basic.

Created AI model build settings table: Att_Import_Mode_Settings


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Build Attribute Importance Model
paragraphs.text:
%script

--Build an AI model. 

DECLARE
v_sql varchar2(100);

  
--Build Attribute Importance Model
BEGIN
   DBMS_DATA_MINING.CREATE_MODEL(
     model_name 	  	    => 'GOOD_WINE_AI',
     mining_function		=> DBMS_DATA_MINING.ATTRIBUTE_IMPORTANCE,
     data_table_name		=> 'WineReviews130KTarget',
     case_id_column_name 	=> 'ID',
     target_column_name	    => 'POINTS_BIN',
     settings_table_name 	=> 'Att_Import_Mode_Settings');

END;

msg.data: PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Build a Machine Learning Model That Predicts Good Wine (GT_90_POINTS)  (Supervised Learning Classification Model using OML's Random Forest Algorithm)

msg.data:
DROP TABLE Wine_build_settings PURGE: drop unneccessary - no table exists
CALL DBMS_DATA_MINING.DROP_MODEL('Wine_CLASS_MODEL'): drop unneccessary - no
model exists
DROP TABLE Wine_APPLY_RESULT PURGE: drop unneccessary - no table exists
DROP TABLE Wine_LIFT_TABLE PURGE: drop unneccessary - no table exists
Created model build settings table: Wine_build_settings 
Created model: Wine_CLASS_MODEL 
Created apply result: Wine_APPLY_RESULT 
Created lift result: Wine_LIFT_TABLE 


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Show Lift Chart for Model Evaluation;   Looks Like a Good Predictive Model!
paragraphs.text:
%sql

--Show the Lift Chart for evaluating the model.
--Hint: Change the barchart to a line graph to see how good the model is.

SELECT QUANTILE_NUMBER, GAIN_CUMULATIVE FROM Wine_LIFT_TABLE;

paragraphs.title: Let's Explore the Wines that are predicted to be Good Wines
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- COST here refers to a machine learning modeling term and can be ignored
-- Explore the Wines that are predicted to be good wines.
-- Hint : Change the Prediction from the drop down to see the predictions for GT_90_Points / LT_90_Points

SELECT ID, PREDICTION, PROBABILITY FROM Wine_APPLY_RESULT WHERE PREDICTION = ${PREDICTION='GT_90_Points','GT_90_Points'|'LT_90_Points'} order by probability desc;

Still full of young tannins, it will develop well over the next few years. Wait to drink until 2019.

paragraphs.title: Show 1,000 Wines that are less than $15 and their predicted Points (looking for really inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Show 1000 Wines which are less than $15 and the predicted Points(looking for inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)

SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 1000 and Price < 15) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

paragraphs.text:
%md
### See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database?   Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!
### Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using the Oracle Analytics Cloud!

msg.data:
See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database? Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!

Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using the Oracle Analytics Cloud!

paragraphs.title: For Running this Notebook Again, Remove Any Previous WinePredictons Table

msg.data:
DROP TABLE WinePredictons PURGE: succeeded


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Create WinePredictions table in ADW for Access by Oracle Analytics Cloud
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- Create table WinePredictons for viewing in Oracle Analytics Cloud

CREATE TABLE WinePredictons AS 
  SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL USING *) pset
          FROM WINEREVIEWS130KTARGET
         WHERE ID < 100000 and Price < 500) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;
